stories.text:
Mindful is a leader in the customer experience market, and we’re reinventing the customer experience with our SaaS based platform Mindful. Our products enable people to get the help they need, from brands they love, on terms they choose. We’re do this by providing contact centers solutions that optimize customer interactions across all their channels and we’re expanding fast.
We are looking for talented developers to join our Engineering team to help build a state-of-the-art SaaS platform.
On the backend we primarily use nodejs/typescript on top of event driven serverless technologies with some services leveraging ruby on rails.  On the frontend, we use React/Typescript/GraphQL to create delightful and engaging user experience that help drive the adoption of our cx technologies. Our stacks are entirely based on AWS.
Open Roles: Sr. Full stack Developer - DevOps Engineer - Analytics Engineer – Senior Software Developer
We offer competitive pay and excellent benefits (health, vision, dental, 401k, etc) and a very straightforward application and interview process.
If interested, apply using the link below or email directly at talent@getmindful.com!
See all of our job postings at https://getmindful.com/careers
stories.title: Mindful| Multiple Roles – US Remote – Full-Time – HTTPS://Www.getmindful.com

stories.text:
Hello HN,

I (firmware/software) and a group of fellow mechanical (1x) electrical (1x) engineers often wax about starting a company. None of us are interested in managing anything non engineering-related. Where do you usually find the manager types for your startup? You know, the ones who can talk to investors, do the government paperwork, and other boring stuff.
stories.title: Ask HN: Engineers Running a Business?

stories.text:
Karambol is an AI-powered travel guide. It works like a search engine and aims to provide relevant travel itineraries while matching one's travel preferences.

As a traveler, I'm quite frustrated by paper guides. Way too long to read! Plus, I feel the editors add new “must see” things every year just to justify the new edition (and the price). I'm also frustrated at travel blogs where storytelling is over-used.

I like having the “best of the best” places to visit and have help building my itinerary. I know many others do the same. This is why I started Karambol, which is a side project so far.

Any feedbacks are welcomed!
stories.title: Show HN: AI-Powered Travel Guide
